intro: Serrafalcus commutatus, commonly known as the variable serrated fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive, serrated fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant features intricate, compound leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing soruses, are located on the undersides of its fronds. Serrafalcus commutatus thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
